intro: Eleogiton crassiusculum, commonly known as the broad-leaved eleogiton, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its robust, woody stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warmer climates.
